output: Hello! Welcome to Dev-Release. How can I assist you today?
Hi there! I am Prageeth's AI assistant. What's on your mind?
Prageeth Priyamantha is the developer behind Dev-Release and the founder of P&S Software Solution.
Dev-Release is a tech blog focusing on software development, app reviews, and coding tutorials.
You can find Dev-Release on YouTube at: https://www.youtube.com/@Dev-Release
Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/share/1CMtrYSTxu/
P&S Software Solution is a software company founded by Prageeth Priyamantha.
Start with basics like HTML and CSS, then learn logic with JavaScript. Practice every day!
Python is a powerful, beginner-friendly programming language used in AI, data science, and web development.
JavaScript is the language of the web, used to make websites interactive.
HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the backbone of any website structure.
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to style and design your HTML content.
Flutter and React Native are great for cross-platform apps. For native, use Kotlin or Swift.
Flutter is Google's UI toolkit for building beautiful apps from a single codebase.
React Native is a framework by Meta used to build mobile apps using JavaScript and React.
Learn HTML, CSS, and JS. Then explore frameworks like React or platforms like Blogger/WordPress.
An API allows different software programs to communicate with each other.
Backend is the server-side of an application that handles data and logic (e.g., Node.js, PHP, Python).
Frontend is what users see and interact with in their browser (HTML, CSS, JS).
A database is a place where software stores its data, like MySQL, MongoDB, or Firebase.
Firebase is a Google platform that provides tools like hosting, database, and auth for app developers.
It can be challenging at first, but with patience and practice, anyone can learn it.
VS Code is currently the most popular and versatile code editor.
Git is a version control system used to track changes in your code.
GitHub is a cloud-based platform where you can host and share your Git repositories.
Open source software allows anyone to view, modify, and distribute its source code.
It's the delivery of computing services (servers, storage, etc.) over the internet.
Both are leading cloud providers. AWS is more mature, while Azure integrates well with Microsoft tools.
It is the practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks.
A bug is an error or flaw in a computer program that causes it to produce an unexpected result.
Debugging is the process of finding and fixing errors in your code.
A famous Q&A site where developers help each other solve coding problems.
Many developers prefer Dark Mode because it reduces eye strain during long coding sessions.
A developer who can work on both the frontend and backend of an application.
DevOps combines development and operations to shorten the development life cycle.
Artificial Intelligence is the simulation of human intelligence by machines.
A subset of AI that allows machines to learn from data without explicit programming.
A decentralized, distributed digital ledger used for record-keeping.
Cryptocurrency is a digital or virtual currency secured by cryptography.
Non-Fungible Token, a unique digital asset stored on a blockchain.
Internet of Things - connecting everyday objects to the internet.
RAM is temporary working memory; ROM is permanent storage for system instructions.
SSDs are much faster and more reliable than traditional HDDs.
Central Processing Unit - the brain of the computer.
Graphics Processing Unit - handles rendering images and videos, also used in AI.
An open-source operating system kernel used widely in servers and development.
A popular, user-friendly Linux distribution.
Apple's operating system, popular among developers for its Unix-based core.
The latest major version of Microsoft's operating system.
Android is open and versatile; iOS is known for its smooth performance and security.
The official store for Android apps.
The official store for iOS and macOS apps.
Making money from apps through ads, subscriptions, or in-app purchases.
Google's mobile advertising platform for monetizing apps.
User Interface - the visual elements users interact with (buttons, colors, fonts).
User Experience - how a user feels when interacting with a product or system.
A design that adjusts itself to look good on all screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop).
Search Engine Optimization - improving your site to rank higher in search results.
A tool to monitor and maintain your site's presence in Google Search.
A service that tracks and reports website traffic.
Write quality content, use clear headings, and be consistent with your posts.
Share on social media, use SEO, and engage with your readers.
Comment your code, keep it simple (KISS), and don't repeat yourself (DRY).
Code that is easy to read, understand, and maintain.
Testing individual components of a program to ensure they work correctly.
Software as a Service - software delivered over the internet via subscription.
Virtual Private Server - a virtual machine sold as a service by hosting providers.
The address people use to find your website (e.g., devrelease-apps.blogspot.com).
A service that allows you to post a website onto the internet.
Secures the connection between a browser and a server (the 'https' part).
HTTPS is the secure version of HTTP, encrypted using SSL/TLS.
Small files stored on your computer by websites to remember your data.
Temporary storage that helps websites and apps load faster.
Node Package Manager - the world's largest software registry for JS libraries.
JavaScript Object Notation - a lightweight format for storing and transporting data.
Structured Query Language used for managing data in relational databases.
Non-relational databases that store data in formats other than tables (e.g., MongoDB).
A platform used to build, test, and deploy applications in containers.
An open-source system for automating deployment and management of containerized apps.
A cloud computing model where the provider manages the server infrastructure.
Small pieces of code that run in response to events (AWS Serverless).
An architectural style that structures an app as a collection of small services.
A traditional unified model for software program design.
A project management approach based on iterative development and feedback.
A framework within Agile for managing complex projects.
Integrated Development Environment - a tool like IntelliJ, Eclipse, or Xcode.
A program that translates high-level code into machine language.
A program that executes instructions directly without prior compilation.
The most basic level of computer data, consisting of 0s and 1s.

input: how to stay updated in tech
